turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Tell us every detail.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You've only known Jake a few months.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Has Paul heard about his promotion?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, not yet. But you know Paul. He's sure to get it.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Paul could pop the question at any time.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mom, please.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Especially with a promotion in the offing.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I gather he's late as usual.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Can I get you a glass of champagne?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I'm here, Sweetheart. I'm here. It's going to be OK.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Oh, Letty, what happened?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mom, I was there, and I just, I was so... They didn't have the olives, and I, I got so upset. I don't know how it happened.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I've talked to Doctor Emlee, and he says...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm so glad to see you. You can't believe the people in here. They've got patients posing as doctors...

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Everyone says it's the best facility in the area for this sort of thing.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I just want to go home.   Can we go home now?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Maybe I should talk about this with Ruth, or Paul.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: We all agree with the doctor, Dear. He thinks it's safer for you to stay here for a while.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: But what about Beast?   Who'll...?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Ruth's already taken him home.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And my class. It'll be hard to find a good substitute. And what about my math program?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Paul said he'd call the school.  And your father thinks he's convinced the guard not to press charges as long as you get help.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I'll see you soon.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Tomorrow?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: As soon as Dr. Emlee says.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: It's so good to see you, Sweetheart.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You too, Mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: You're looking good.    A little thin, but good.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Which flowers did you order?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: We haven't. I wanted to talk that over with you, too.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Oh, OK, well, better to choose the table cloths first anyway.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I was thinking either the peach moire or cream damask.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: We aren't allowed to wear jewelry in here, Mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Just think, pretty soon, we'll be doing all these wedding preparations for you.  Of course, if that's what you still want. Ruthie told me some silly story about a crush on some boy here.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I haven't had a crush since I was

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: When did you start smoking?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I hear this Michael fellow is schizophrenic.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mom, please.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Don't forget that Paul's a promising young attorney who loves you very much...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mom, look, if I want to dump Paul, I'll dump him. If I want to screw Michael or live with him or marry him, then I'll do that.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I'm only looking out for you.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And if I want to smoke, I'll fucking smoke.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Must you walk so quickly?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's good exercise, Mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I'm so thankful you'll be leaving next week. If you want me to pick you up, I will.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I've already made arrangements.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mom, we agreed. You can visit, but you're not allowed to mention Michael.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Not even if it's something positive?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Honestly, Letty.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: A deal's a deal.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael just got a job.    Couldn't you congratulate him?

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: I will, Dear. I promise.  Why McDonald's?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: He's been looking everywhere for weeks, Mom.   It's not that easy after you've been locked away.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm going to take that as an honest effort at being open minded.

turns.speaker: MRS. MAYER
turns.text: Don't be fresh.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Just remember that I love him.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm really not that hungry.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: Just eat whatever you want. This will give you a chance to meet some people.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: Letty, you should be in bed.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: There's a spider in my room.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's got a green dot on its back. I can't go to sleep with it watching me.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: Sounds awful. I guess we better check it out.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It had this red spot on its back.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: Green spot.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Mottled really.   Green and red.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: I don't know why you feel you have to lie, Letty.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Lie?

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: If you feel lonely, or need to talk, all you have to do is say so.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: To talk?  Well, OK, that might be good.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: I understand you just got engaged. Maybe that's where we should start.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I don't mean to go on and on like this.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: It's OK.   It's good to let it out.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: You can only do what feels best to you now.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I guess so. I think that's right.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You've been so great. I just feel a lot clearer about things.

turns.speaker: NURSE GATES
turns.text: I'm glad.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Do you mind if I call you Letitia?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Letty.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: First off, Letty, can you tell me where you are?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I answered these questions last night.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know this can be a real drag, but the attending physician on day shift is required to do his own prelim exam when a patient is admitted during the night.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, 79. Sorry, this makes me nervous.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's OK. It's not a pass-fail kind of thing.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Chair, cup and ball.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Terrific.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Let me shift gears here a minute...  Do you ever hear voices that other people don't hear or see things they don't?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What about patterns? Do you find yourself checking and re-checking locks? Or washing your hands over and over again?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yes?   Go right ahead.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Sometimes my food, and my clothes, and my underwear.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How do you sort it--by lace and cotton?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: By color.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What if it's got a pattern?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Is this really important? Because I don't think it's a problem.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: A while, I guess.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That must be really difficult.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey there. They're showing "Groundhog Day" if you...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You took bets on my diagnosis?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's no big deal.   We all compare.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Who do you think you are?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't take it personally.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You have no right, no right to take the worst thing that's ever happened to me and make it into some kind of game.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Stop acting like you're someone special. You're just like the rest of us.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm not the one who's masquerading as a doctor. I'm not the one who's, who's...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What are you looking to read?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Anything interesting.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: But you're checking it out.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've already checked it out 17 times.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You missed out on some great broccoli florets at dinner.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I wasn't hungry.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: John even managed to lob a load of mashed potatoes into Mrs. Hallstrom's milk.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Finally. I was getting tired of watching him try every night.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Was it bad news--the visit from Peter?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Paul.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: He asked me to marry him.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Very romantic setting.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It was romantic.   He's very romantic.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So are you engaged, or what?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What have you done with the ring?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's magic.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Guess which hand.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Enough with the abracadabra.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Guess.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: The left one.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Really, this isn't funny.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: OK, OK, I'll give it back.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: For a price.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Good God.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A small price.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I won't do your portion of kitchen cleanup.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And I'm not covering for you when you sneak out to call Dominos.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: We're supposed to be asleep.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: We'll get caught.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No rounds for another three hours.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nervous? Scared? Worried you're not fit for a caper of epic proportions?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Rendezvous at the closet in 30.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A daisy for the lady.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: The lady knows this is a dandelion.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: A rose is a rose.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Thanks.    Where've you been all day?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Back-to-back sessions with the shrink.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm not allowed to see you anymore.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Really?    Me too.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I had to sneak by the guards to get here. They say you're highly unstable, have a depressive personality, and may hold back my own recovery.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Wow.    I'm bad news.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What's my rap?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Schizophrenic recidivism marked by hallucinations and paranoid delusions.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Really, though. My thoughts go haywire sometimes.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What are the delusions like?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Shocking, huh?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Sure. But I took out a whole grocery store.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I wish I could have seen that.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm starting to think that everyone's crazy to some extent.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: My Grandma Rosa says that some trees get planted in rich top soil, and they grow right up to the sun, tall and straight. Other trees, they start as seeds in the crevices between rocks so they have to twist and bend to reach the light.  But even though they end up crooked, they're still trees, just like the straight ones.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why in the world did you let me start talking in metaphors? That's no way for us to break up.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Break up?    They wish.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You must have thought about it. Everyone does.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I just want to see Beast.  Where would you go?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The mission up in Santa Barbara.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's where I always go when I get out.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What else would you do?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'd like to drink a bottle of red wine with you and then make love to you and spend the whole night together. And we'd get up in the morning and spend hours lounging around and reading the paper.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And we'd eat Spaghetti-O's in bed from the can.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How can you even mention Spaghetti- O's after eating Grandma Rosa's dinner tonight?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I have a terrible confession.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Tell the doctor.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I don't like lamb.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Then it's over.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Lie down.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's a good thing my family loves you.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Your family just met me.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're right. I guess I was projecting. What I should have said is, "It's a good thing I love you."

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael, I...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's OK. You don't have to say anything.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: But I do.     I love you, too.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: John and Nurse Gates are waiting for you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Oh, right.     I'm ready.   How do I look?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Great. I came to tell you to break a leg, and to give you this for good luck.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Home free.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Tell me all.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I was brilliant, or at least boringly sane.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: So there were no problems?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Not a one.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And did you go to the mission?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Just checking.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I saw Paul leaving.    Did you do the dirty deed?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So, it's over?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: All over.  Did you see your new apartment?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Furnished?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, I need some serious household advice.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: First off, you'll need to go to Target. And, let's see, what should you buy?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I better make a list.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: List schmist. You'll remember.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Aren't you supposed to throw a bouquet or something?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Aren't you ever quiet?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I've heard the mission in Santa Barbara is the place to go.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This is it -- 3B.     Check it out.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Open up.    I want to see.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You like it?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I love the pillows.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Throw pillows, Letty. The sales lady said they're the latest thing.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Very trendy. Let's see the rest.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's TV heaven.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I was tired of watching what everyone else wants to watch. Now we can watch two shows at once.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Let's try out the bed.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You've got to see the kitchen first.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Do you like it?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I love your apartment.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What do you say we go out to dinner to celebrate?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Out? Are you kidding?     I've got all the fixings here.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: How can you not like the Top 10 List?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I like it.     But Headlines are better.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You're so wrong.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's sex time.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Did I get spaghetti sauce on my face?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Shhhh.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll be forced to tickle you.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm supposed to meet the principal in half an hour.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll see you tonight.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You, too. Kick ass today.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sounds good. Oh, and Letty?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You've got one hell of a great body.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Gosh, Letty, this is a great place.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This must be Beast.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: That's Mr. Beast to you.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I bombed. It's either work in the office or nothing.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sounds grim.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah.    How was the job search?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Who ever said sanity was fun?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It doesn't matter.    It'll work out.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Promise?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Promise.  As long as we have steak.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Steak?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The store was busy.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You got wine. That's great.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Would you mind if we just called it an early night?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You go ahead and relax. I'll cook.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I think I should go home.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Are you OK?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Big restaurant interview tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Four interviews. Four no-gos.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: The restaurant, too?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I couldn't even face that one.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: That's OK. We can call and reschedule in the morning.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You don't have to take care of me, you know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just promise you'll love me even if I end up in a job where I have to wear a blue polyester cap.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I think you know I'd love you even more in a blue polyester cap.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You're going to miss the Top Ten.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Coming.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey, Letty. Mrs. Mayer.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I got worried. Are you OK?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How may I help you?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Aunt Lily is the one who married your father's cousin?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, that's Aunt Connie. Lily is the one who looks like a hooker.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Oh. And, Harry, he's the one who likes magic?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You don't have to know all this by Saturday. It took me years.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Aunt Lily?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Bingo.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: When he could get time off from the restaurant business.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How about a dance?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Bye, Uncle Cort.  What's with the lie?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It wasn't exactly a lie.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What is it? Are you OK?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Always the drugs.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I saw you talking to my Mom.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: We both talked to her, Michael. And your dad.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What do you mean not taking your meds?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why'd you tell?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I didn't talk to her about medications, Michael. Don't be silly.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Silly?   Silly am I?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael, take it easy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Silly, silly, silly.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I think I should call someone.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't upset my Mom.     Don't you upset my Mom.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael, calm down. Please. It's OK.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I guess we need to talk.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's hard to know where to start.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I sure know what that feels like.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: And all the plans we have.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yeah, the plans.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I've been thinking I could try to visit you at night after work, and then there'd be more time on weekends to see...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Letty, please.
